means: 狂怒，盛怒( rage的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: He was often caustic and mocking, or flew into rages.
sentence.Network_cn: 他常常讽刺或挖苦人，有时又会大发雷霆。

sentence.Network_en: Meanwhile, the domestic debate on Denmark's future role in Europe rages on.
sentence.Network_cn: 与此同时，国内也展开了有关丹麦未来在欧洲扮演何种角色的激烈争论。

sentence.Network_en: The war rages on and the time has come to take sides.
sentence.Network_cn: 战乱肆虐，是时候表明立场了。

“路怒症”（Road Rage）这个词最近几年才在中文媒体上变得常见。但在美国，它已经让交警头疼多年。
路怒（road rage）(roadrage)是形容在交通阻塞情况下开车压力与挫折所导致的愤怒情绪，“路怒（road rage）症”发作者会袭击他人的汽车，有时无辜的同车乘客 …

entry.def: Rage is strong anger that is difficult to control.
You say that something powerful or unpleasant rages when it continues with great force or violence.

example.ex: Train services were halted as the fire raged for more than four hours...
example.tran: 火灾肆虐超过4个小时，期间列车停止了运行。

example.ex: ...the fierce arguments raging over the future of the Holy City...
example.tran: 关于圣城未来的激烈争论

entry.def: If you rage about something, you speak or think very angrily about it.

example.ex: Monroe was on the phone, raging about her mistreatment by the brothers...
example.tran: 门罗正在打电话，怒不可遏地说着她被这几个兄弟虐待的事。
弗兰妮正在屋里大发脾气。

entry.tran: （尤指引发暴力或攻击行为的）暴怒,盛怒
entry.def: You can refer to the strong anger that someone feels in a particular situation as a particular rage, especially when this results in violent or aggressive behaviour.

example.ex: Cabin crews are reporting up to nine cases of air rage a week.
example.tran: 乘务人员一周内报告的飞机上闹事行为多达9起。

entry.def: When something is popular and fashionable, you can say that it is the rage or all the rage .

example.ex: The 1950s look is all the rage at the moment.
example.tran: 目前，20世纪50年代的装扮正流行。
